title: Kulu Ferreira
text:
Petrus Stephanus 'Kulu' Ferreira (born 17 March 1959) is a South African former <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> player.
Playing career.
Ferreira grew up in <a href="Kroonstad">Kroonstad</a> in the <a href="Free%20State%20%28province%29">Free State</a>. He represented the <a href="Griffons%20%28rugby%20team%29">Northern Free State</a> schools team at the annual <a href="Craven%20Week">Craven Week</a> tournament in 1976 and in 1977, when he also captained the side. After school he enrolled at <a href="Stellenbosch%20University">Stellenbosch University</a> where he played for the University's different age–group teams. Ferreira made his senior provincial debut for <a href="Western%20Province%20%28rugby%20team%29">Western Province</a> in 1981 and played for the union until 1985. In September 1985, Ferreira moved to <a href="France">France</a>, where he played for the rugby club in <a href="Marmande">Marmande</a>. He returned to South Africa and the Northern Free State in the middle of 1986, where he continued his rugby career.
Ferreira made his debut for the <a href="Springboks">Springboks</a> on 20 October 1984 against the <a href="South%20American%20Jaguars">South American Jaguars</a> at Loftus Versveld in Pretoria. He also played in the second test against the South Americans and scored a try.
